str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.
And, even, also, namely.
A prostitute; met: an idolatrous community. Feminine of pornos; a strumpet; figuratively, an idolater.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
Lastly, afterward, later. Neuter of husteros as adverb; more lately, i.e. Eventually.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From meta and the middle voice of melo; to care afterwards, i.e. Regret.
From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
